trans-unit.source: Use labels to instrument queries in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use labels to instrument queries in SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for using labels to instrument queries in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for using labels to instrument queries in Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Use labels to instrument queries in SQL Data Warehouse
trans-unit.target: Use labels to instrument queries in SQL Data Warehouse

trans-unit.source: SQL Data Warehouse supports a concept called query labels.
trans-unit.target: SQL Data Warehouse supports a concept called query labels.

trans-unit.source: Before going into any depth let's look at an example of one:
trans-unit.target: Before going into any depth let's look at an example of one:

trans-unit.source: This last line tags the string 'My Query Label' to the query.
trans-unit.target: This last line tags the string 'My Query Label' to the query.

trans-unit.source: This is particularly helpful as the label is query-able through the DMVs.
trans-unit.target: This is particularly helpful as the label is query-able through the DMVs.

trans-unit.source: This provides us with a mechanism to track down problem queries and also to help identify progress through an ETL run.
trans-unit.target: This provides us with a mechanism to track down problem queries and also to help identify progress through an ETL run.

trans-unit.source: A good naming convention really helps here.
trans-unit.target: A good naming convention really helps here.

trans-unit.source: For example something like ' PROJECT : PROCEDURE : STATEMENT : COMMENT' would help to uniquely identify the query in amongst all the code in source control.
trans-unit.target: For example something like ' PROJECT : PROCEDURE : STATEMENT : COMMENT' would help to uniquely identify the query in amongst all the code in source control.

trans-unit.source: To search by label you can use the following query that uses the dynamic management views:
trans-unit.target: To search by label you can use the following query that uses the dynamic management views:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] It is essential that you wrap square brackets or double quotes around the word label when querying.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] It is essential that you wrap square brackets or double quotes around the word label when querying.

trans-unit.source: Label is a reserved word and will caused an error if it has not been delimited.
trans-unit.target: Label is a reserved word and will caused an error if it has not been delimited.

trans-unit.source: For more development tips, see [development overview][].
trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see [development overview][].
